paper_abstract: Fully discrete potential-based finite element methods called A - phi methods are used to solve a transient eddy current problem in a three-dimensional convex bounded polyhedron. Using A - phi methods, fully discrete coupled and decoupled numerical schemes are developed. The existence and uniqueness of solutions for these schemes together with the energy-norm error estimates are provided. To verify the validity of both schemes, some computer simulations are performed for the model from TEAM Workshop Problem 7.
paper_title: Fully discrete potential-based finite element methods for a transient eddy current problem
